New Records: New Zealand ended an 11-year wait for a win in Australia
New Zealand posted their first 200-run total in a T20 World Cup match
Devon Conway hit the highest score in T20Is against Australia with 92 not out
Tim Southee became the leading wicket-taker in men's T20Is with 125 wickets
Key Match Events: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in Sydney
Australia never really looked in control after losing David Warner early
Tim Southee picked up 3 wickets, including that of David Warner and Mitchell Marsh, while giving away just 6 runs
Mitchell Santner picked up 3 wickets, breaking the back of the Australian batting unit
Post-Match Reflections: Australia need to focus on improving their Net Run Rate as the 89-run defeat hampered their NRR, sinking it to -4.450.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the biggest margin of defeat in terms of runs for Australia in T20Is, and the second biggest defeat for a full-time ICC member in T20 World Cups.
Others: New Zealand sent a warning notice to the rest of the teams in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
Kane Williamson's men laid down an early marker despite not heading into the tournament with any 'favourites' tag
